clinical_study.brief_title: Identifying Patients With Unrecognized Treatable Diabetic Macular Edema
clinical_study.official_title: Identifying Patients With Unrecognized Treatable Diabetic Macular Edema

brief_summary.textblock: This trial will assess the incidence of new and/or undiagnosed diabetic macular edema (DME) in diabetic patients that undergo a DME screening exam. The screening exam will consist of medical history, Electronic ETDRS visual acuity assessment, SD-OCT and color fundus photography

primary_outcome.measure: Assess the incidence of new and/or undiagnosed diabetic macular edema.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day (Patients are only seen once for assessments)
primary_outcome.description: This trial will assess the incidence of new and/or undiagnosed diabetic macular edema (DME) in diabetic patients that undergo a DME screening exam. The screening exam will consist of medical history, Electronic ETDRS visual acuity assessment, SD-OCT and color fundus photography

secondary_outcome.measure: Streamlining and identification of patients at risk of diabetic macular edema
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day (Patients only seen once for assessments)
secondary_outcome.description: Establish methods for streamlining screening and identification of patients at risk. Establish methods for referral for treatment of patients identified with vision threatening diabetic retinopathy.

study_pop.textblock: Patients identified through medical records or admitted into Franklin Square Hospital with a history of diabetes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ability to provide written informed consent and comply with study assessments for the full duration of the study
- Age > 18 years
- Patient related considerations
- Patients with diabetes mellitus
- Disease related considerations
- Diabetes mellitus
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior admission screening within twelve months.
- Inability to sit for evaluation
